page.title: 03Hobs Moat in Solihull
page.content: This area, with its royal links, is recorded in the original Domesday Book. The Conqueror gave the Manor of Ulverlei to Cristina.She was the sister of Edgar the Atheling, last male of the Saxon royal family who handed the throne of England to William. In 1086 an estimated 145 people lived in the area between the moat and the present site of St. Margaret's Church. The origin of the name Hobs Moat is not clear. The Odingsells family owned the manor in 1213. Their name has also been recorded as Hoginsells - giving the name Hoggs Moat leading to Hobs Moat. Supernatural ties have also been made with this area, Hob being a Medieval term for the devil. In early 1985, The Solihull Times reported on evidence of modern-day witchcraft taking place in the Moat amongst the 258 Oak trees which now cover the historical site.
